New Records: The Dodgers have thrown 33 straight scoreless innings, matching the postseason record established by the 1966 Orioles.
Key Match Events: Kodai Senga struggled, walking the bases loaded in the first inning and allowing two runs.
Senga's velocity was down, averaging only 93.5 mph with his four-seam fastballs.
Senga walked the leadoff hitter in the second inning, leading to another run.
Shohei Ohtani hit an RBI single in the second inning, ending Senga's outing.
Jack Flaherty pitched seven shutout innings, allowing only two hits with two walks and six strikeouts.
Jose Butto loaded the bases in the eighth inning before Mookie Betts delivered a three-run double.
Post-Match Reflections: Kodai Senga expressed frustration and disappointment, citing mechanics as the root of his troubles.
Manager Carlos Mendoza mentioned it's too early to determine if Senga will get another start.
Francisco Lindor stated that the team was ready but didn't play better than the Dodgers.
